fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31708].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

# Link together a JIRA 6.2-OD-03, Confluence 5.3-OD-12 instance (or just use OnDemand) and JIRA Macros v 5.2 is installed. 
# Create an issue in JIRA and resolve it
# Create a page in Confluence,
# Add the JIRA Issues Macro and perform a JQL search for the issue in step 2. Under display options add the Resolved field.
# Save the page

Result:

Resolutiondate (all one word for some reason) will be displayed, but it will be empty

Expected result:

Resolution date will appear in the resolutiondate field.

PS: This is affecting Confluence 5.3/5.3.4 and also JIRA issues macro version 5.1.1 and 5.1.3.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro doesn't show resolution date

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31697].
  {panel}

We are using Livesearch, which is set to filter search results by a specific label.

However, when we introduce a search word and type Enter, the search returns results from pages that don't have that label.
Somebody has already pointed out this same wrong behaviour in the Livesearch macro page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Livesearch+Macro?showComments=true, but still without feedback.

We are currently using Confluence 5.3.x.

Could you please have a look at it?
Thanks!!

Hi Atlassian Team,
when using the attachments macro in a page, it will render the content-frame in the versions view.
It only happens one time after a pages has been loaded, for the first versions view opened. It stays persistent until the page is reloaded.
See attached screenshot.

We use refined wiki, and asked their support first - see https://refinedwiki.atlassian.net/browse/RWOT-494 . The problem occurs in documentation theme aswell.

Help would be greatly appreciated.

Best

Matin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31680].
  {panel}

Affects plugin version 3.6.2.

Page Properties Macro loses values if title has formatting
And the formatting is show in the report

To recreate:
Create a page with Page Properties and Page Properties Report on the same page with the same tag.
Add a table in the Page Properties with two rows

Put this in the table
Key1, Value1
Key2, Value2

Not mark Key2 and make it bold

Save Page
Look at Key2 in the Report macro

It is now with a small "k", and the value is missing.
See attached image

Recreate with funnier data:
Edit page, Add Key3 and Value3, select Key3 and select formatting "Quote"
Save Page and inspect report
Key3 is formatted as Quote in the Table header
See attached image


Expected:
The values should always be shown.
Less important, remove formatting.
fields.summary: Page Properties Macro loses values if title has formatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31664].
  {panel}

I work in a distributed team that extensively uses Confluence wiki. So keep myself up-to-date I'm "watching" pages, also i have an "rss" set up to chow changes made to pages tagged by a specific label.

"Watching" pages is nice, because you get diff of a page's before/after state, which RSS doesn't provide (because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26109, which I consider an odd decision, a kind of reluctance, and in current state it is a real issue to guess what has been added/changed/removed by looking at a message in RSS without a walk in browser; a side thought: then at least would be nice to have a configuration option in RSS builder to switch off showing of a content in RSS messages to keep RSS posts concise as all-in-all they do not provide info i'm looking for).

However "watching" pages itself is not perfect too. Because people create new pages here and there, and it is not possible to watch a page along with its child pages (besides, sometimes pages of interest just cannot be organized in a parent-child page structure in a natural way). At the same time it is relatively easy to train everyone in a team to use a set of tags. But again, Confluence has no way to "watch" changes made to a tagged content. Would be nice to have that.

And, finally, there is another problem with "watching" for changes in pages:   frequently people do not make all changes to a page in a single edit. So they edit a bit, then look and remember something and edit again, or update content during a day until it is stabilized and etc. And in turn I get a couple of emails related to a single change. I wish i cold receive only one notification in this case, e.g. send a notification for a particular page only after some quiet time. Alternatively i can imagine an option to switch to a periodic (e.g. daily) receiving of "page-watching" notifications, with automatic merging of a changes made by a single person to a single page.

What do you think about all that?
fields.summary: Watch tagged pages and optionally summarize notifications during a day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31662].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian, 

i have a translation issue here. The translation for "watching" pages is wrong in a very particular way, The german word "überwachen" has many very bad connotations. The meaning is more like "observing" or "supervising". This makes every german user i encounter react, on one hand because of the actual NSA discussion, on the other hand because of german history. Surveillance made a lot of dark chapters in german history, the last not long ago in GDR before 1990. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stasi for ex. 

I am not that captious normally, but in that case i'd really wish that you could change the wording. There are two options that would do better: "abonnieren" oder "beobachten", whereas "abonnieren" is the more factual alternative with a meaning more like "subscribe". This would do best in my opinion. I added translations for all the occurrences of the word "überwachen" to "abonnieren" here: https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/translate#/48/5085/0/ACCEPTED_TRANSLATIONS/ALL/%C3%BCberwachen

Best wishes

Matin
fields.summary: German translation for "watching"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31629].
  {panel}

In Confluence,  each user can disable/enable some of keyboard shortcuts with [this procedure|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts#KeyboardShortcuts-Disablingandre-enablingkeyboardshortcuts].

But such like "Ctrl (Cmd) + Shift + J" which activates Japanese FEP in Mac OS is controlled by JIRA Macros", not by shortcut-plugin.  So user can't control this shortcut  "Ctrl (Cmd) +Shift +J" in above procedure. 
If user wants to disable "Ctrl (Cmd) + Shift +J",  user must disable or rebuild "JIRA Macro" and this impacts all user of Confluence.

It is very nice if each user can control all of keyboard shortcuts in Confluence.

Regards,
fields.summary: Enable the users to control the all of keyboard shortcuts in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31616].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a file list page
* Make 3 identical copies of a file, and give the files different names like: 'image1.jpg', 'image2.jpg', 'image3.jpg'
* Use the 'browse for files' link to upload each of the identical files

Expected: Each of the files should upload successfully
Actual: Some files do not trigger an upload and there is no error. After selecting the file the spinner does not appear and no file is uploaded.

There is no identifiable pattern which of the 3 will fail to upload, but it is consistent that always one of them will.

Retested on chrome/firefox where the issue does not appear.
fields.summary: IE11 - Some files uploaded to File List Page fails to upload without error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31574].
  {panel}

Customer pointed out that:
{quote}
In https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.3+Upgrade+Notes Atlassian writes
{noformat}
Some translations not available in 5.3
Translations for several new features, including the new Create Space dialog, new blueprints, Whitelist and the Livesearch macro, are not available in this release. We *hope* to make these translations available shortly after this release in 5.3.1.  If you use a language pack other than English, we do not recommend you upgrade to Confluence 5.3 yet. 
{noformat}

Unfortunately i can't find more information on this. Is this translation issue fixed with 5.3.1?
{quote}

I've checked in 5.3.1 that all of the above were not fully translated to other language than English. We've got the news that there were few missing translations for the business blueprints in 5.3.x and the updated translation will be ready in the coming Confluence 5.4 instead.

Can we get the followings fully translated too in 5.4:
- Create Space dialog:
!create space.jpg!
- Whitelist:
!whitelist.jpg!
- Livesearch macro:
!livesearch.jpg!

Also, can we get the documentation/release notes of 5.4 to clearly indicate about the translation update if they will be implemented in this release.
fields.summary: Update users about translations in the coming 5.4 release notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31566].
  {panel}

This Issue is connected with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30725. In our lozenge and clickable macros we have defined link parameter with type "confluence-content". 
In previous versions of Confluence it was possible to put into this parameter both: 
- link to another Page in Confluence instance  
- URL (for example: http://www.adaptavist.com).  
In Confluence 5.3+ when we put URL as a input - The macro fails to render and displays a red warning icon with the following tooltip:  
{code}Unhandled element type '{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a'{code} 
To reproduce issue I created very simple macro that show confluence behaviour of Confluence for parameter with type "confluence-content". (See the attachment)

There is workaround - to change parameter confluence-content type into string type, however we expect that version Confluence 5.3 should let us use the same type as we were using in previous versions.
fields.summary: Link macro parameter with type confluence-content problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31536].
  {panel}

It's possible to have pages of sufficient length that generating a PDF from them takes longer than 60 seconds and so runs into the Nginx timeout period in OnDemand. This makes it basically impossible to successfully generate a PDF that the customer can access. Confluence should generate PDFs with a long-running task view so we avoid this.

*Workaround*
There are two options that you can take as a workaround.  

The first option is to split one long confluence document into several smaller documents. 

Alternatively, you can use the [Confluence Space / Multiple page export tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF53/Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+PDF] to export the page without it timing out. Please note, you'll need to have the Export Space permission to be able to do this.
fields.summary: PDF Single-page exports should be run in the background with a "Long running task" view to avoid timing out in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31532].
  {panel}

All of our development projects are a combination of a Confluence Space, a JIRA Project and a Stash Project. We want to have a uniform key pattern across all products, but right now every single product key pattern is slightly different.

Can all product converge toward the JIRA pattern? ([A-Z][A-Z_0-9]+)

- *Confluence:* underscores are not supported.
- *Stash:* underscores are not supported, lowercase is not supported.
- *JIRA:* lowercase characters are not supported. 

Right now we are limited to the lowest common denominator between all apps.
fields.summary: consistent key patterns across atlassian products
Correct minor typo on Confluence Gadgets page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31528].
  {panel}

Space XML imports will sometimes fail due to a variety of reasons:
* Confluence runs out of memory
* The import process times out
* Unique key constraint violations
* A few other causes are described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+XML+backups+that+fail+on+restore

Oftentimes these partially imported spaces remain in the DB without any way to remove them via the UI, making a re-import attempt impossible (due to a duplicate Space Key or other constraint violation).

Can we investigate:
- some way to rollback a failed XML space import (or determine whether imports will fail before it starts)?
- possibilities for Confluence to automatically recognise half-imported Spaces and delete related data from the UI?

*Current workaround:* [How to Manually Delete a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Manually+Delete+a+Space] (Cloud users will need to contact Atlassian Support and request removing the Space from Confluence database)
fields.summary: When Space XML Imports Fail, Partial Space Data is Left in the Database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31525].
  {panel}

When a page has a "Children display" macro with the option "include excerpt" checked, it gives a performance issue. When opening that page it will take about 30 seconds to load the page and the cpu will take a high load for that time. 

When unchecking the "include excerpt" option the page will load normally.

Cheers,
Herman Wander
fields.summary: Children display macro with include excerpt gives performance issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31509].
  {panel}

The graph displayed by the global usage tracking pluging (or the Space Activity Screen) will count every page hit, so If a same user access the same page in a day, that will reflect in the graph, hence the page hits are not unique.

We got a ticket about this and I also was able to see multiple people asking the same question :):
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-112732

Page used by the customer on the above ticket:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Viewing+Space+Activity

Since this still behaves like this in our latest version, we need to update that note on all the supported version page (from 4.3 to latest).
fields.summary: We need add a note to Viewing Space Activity page informing that the page hits counted are not unique.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31506].
  {panel}

The ability to embed wiki content from a page into other pages and have either the "original source" or the embedded section editable but kept in sync.

Use: For example, if there is a common piece of information shared across multiple pages currently the easiest way to manage this is to create a link in each page pointing to a separate dedicated page. 

However this can often spoil the instant nature and convenience of the original page especially if the information is just a paragraph or screenshot or small set of instructions and having leaping to a new page disconnects or confuses the user.

This wiki disconnect becomes particularly problematic when exporting a page as a pdf/doc (e.g work instructions) where basic wiki links to content on other pages become invalid or even just when rendering the page contents where a page heading is just a link to another page.

This would work well by being able to embed a page section into another page for example a section defined using the page layout section option (numeric value or header value) or a section just defined by the header value.
fields.summary: Embedded Wiki Content
User or Group Page Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31502].
  {panel}

Hi I feel the Page Layout & Section feature is a game changer in making quick, attractive and easy to read content on Confluence.

I would like to suggest some additions to make it go even further!

1) Allow sub-dividing and resizing of individual Sections with drag-able border rather than having to rely on hitting enter for vertical sizing, especially useful for resizing the horizontal.

2) Allow part or full borders to be drawn around each individual section and fill options, with options to select which sides to render a line, margin size (so to avoid a grid look), corner style, section fill colour and line style. 

Currently you have to insert a standard panel inside a section however a normal panel will only automatically fit the size of the text and not the section so you end up with different sized panels across sections and if you have sections split into 2 or 3 columns having panels of different lengths looks messy.

3) Allow automatic wiki link generation for each vertical section added on a page for example the wiki link to a particular page section would be the page name followed by the section number or page name followed by the first title header of the section. This could even replace the Excerpt so sections could be embedded into other pages conveniently without having to use additional macros and allowing multi-excerpts (each page layout section automatically becomes an excerpt with a unique id).

4) Create option to make entire section clickable with standard wiki link options to other other pages/sections/URLs etc

5) Option to be able Expand and Collapse Sections (also ideally applied to tables, pictures, diagrams and panels).
fields.summary: Page Layout & Sections
Include the "What did you change?" object in the Velocity context so that it can be emailed easily

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31500]. {panel} # Using Source Editor insert the following storage format into a page to test: {noformat}

This is the 1st row of panels.

{noformat} # in *5.2.3* preview page, appears like 2nd image attachment, all in one column. When you save it, appears in 2 separate columns. # in *5.2.5* and *5.3.1* as tested, appears in two columns both in preview and saved copy, as in 1st image attachment. Therefore I am not able to reproduce in versions more recent than 5.2.5. Tested in both Firefox 25 and Google Chrome 30.0.1599.101 and confirmed.
fields.summary: Formatting Differences in Preview and Saved Page
Remove or gray the username filed in Edit User as it's not editable
The create dialog should be less confident in its guesses of where people want to put content
Blogs should force you to choose a space in the Create Dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31490].
  {panel}

To reproduce: 
1. Create a panel macro in the editor.  
2. Add some text and a table
3. Click at the start of the panel and drag down to highlight --> doesnt work, table isn't highlighted or selected.

Expected: should be able to click to highlight the the table and copy it
fields.summary: Trouble copying tables in a panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31488].
  {panel}

Scenario 1:
1. Create applink to from Confluence to JIRA (2LO should be configured by default)
2. Insert JIM on a confluence page - see that it's rendered correctly
3. Disable the OAuth outgoing authentication from Confluence (Do not untick the "Enable outgoing 2-Legged OAuth requests" option
4. View the JIM again - see that a MacroExecutionException is displayed

Scenario 2:
1. Create applink to from Confluence to JIRA (2LO should be configured by default)
2. Insert JIM on a confluence page - see that it's rendered correctly
3. Disabled "Enable outgoing 2-Legged OAuth requests" from the JIRA incoming OAuth authentication
4. View the JIM again - see that a MacroExecutionException is displayed

Ideally we would display message to the end user indicating that there is an applink misconfiguration
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro throws exceptions when applinks are not configured correctly
Whitespace at the base of editable texts in Confluence
Editor alert messages needs some padding and CSS fixes after the recent AUI upgrade
Clarify Migration of Confluence Between Servers Documentation
Chart View with drill down for Page Properties Report
Importing a Confluence Site option is not available for OnDemand with multiple applications
Hability to create a RSS feed on an user
RSS feeds should have option to show diff with the changes
Code macro should wrap long lines

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31463].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

When using the "Create from Template" macro, it will redirect to the dashboard and does not create anything. You can only create those templates from their original "create button" at the top bar.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Disable all three workbox plugins *OR* disable the In-app Notifications
# Create new page and try to use the "Create from template" macro. ex. meeting notes template.
# You will notice the macro redirects to the dashboard.
# Enable back all three workbox plugins
# Create new page and try to use the macro - Works properly

h4. Expectation

The Create from Template macro should work without depending on the workbox or in-app notification, or if it's dependent, it should produce a meaningful error message. 

h4.  Workaround

The workaround is to enable back all the Workbox plugins by sequence
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Common Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Host Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Confluence Provider Plugin
fields.summary: create from template macro redirects to dashboard when workbox is disabled
Screenshots in page make reference to JIRA and Tomcat 5
